headline: Blueberry Smoothie
description: Blueberry smoothie recipes are a favorite way to enjoy fresh or frozen berries, and this one's a winner! Tangy yogurt and a touch of sugar balance it.

video.description: You’d be hard-pressed to find a drink more refreshing than a classic fruit smoothie. This video shows you how to make a blueberry smoothie using either fresh or frozen blueberries, plain yogurt, and milk.
video.name: Blueberry Smoothie Recipe

name: Blueberry Smoothie

recipeInstructions.text: Blend blueberries, yogurt, milk, sugar, vanilla, and nutmeg in a blender until frothy, scraping down the sides of the blender if needed.
Divide between 2 glasses and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: I used 6 oz frozen yogurt and added a little cinnamon/sugar. It was delish!
This is wonderful. Instead of sugar I added a couple tbs of Italian sweet cream creamer. Used almond extract and cinnamon.
I used cinnamon instead of nutmeg and it taste great!
Yummy! I substituted coconut milk and stevia instead and added 2 ice cubes, but left everything else the same. It was delicious!
Even delicious without the yogurt! Also, a bit of cinnamon tastes good with it, too!

When I find a good smoothie recipe like this, I save it. I’m a good cook but I often find less ingredients with right proportions can be perfect. This is. Sweeter than my smoothies but my daughter gives it ten stars!
Awesome smoothie!! The whole family loves it too!
I made 1 1/2 times the recipe, added 1 Tsp. cinnamon and didn't use any sugar. It's really good.
No changes needed. It was easy to make and delicious.
Perfect as is!

Turned out really yummy! If you want more of a berry flavor, you can use strawberry yogurt instead of plain. I listened to some reviews and halved the sugar and used frozen blueberries to make it extra cold.
It was delicious
Loved how simple and tasty this smoothie was! I ended up using honey Greek yogurt and added some chia seeds :)
My 10 year old and I loved it. My 8 year old thought it was just "okay." I'll definitely make it again.

I made this smoothie exactly the way it was and it tasted ok. The smoothie was watered down as if there were too much yogurt and milk, the yogurt flavor overtook everything else, and there weren't enough blueberries. I recommend using less milk and yogurt but adding 1 1/2 cup blueberries.
It was ok... I did not finish it.... but it did have a lot of yogurt taste. It wasn´t really good but it also wasn't that bad.
Very good! I only had flavored yogurt, so I used blueberry yogurt and cut back on the sugar (splenda). Also, added a little crushed ice, because we like it thick. Next time will add a banana too.
This was perfect! I didn't have any nutmeg sadly, but it was great! Totally recommend if you're looking for something simple and delicious :)

OMG game changer!!! i now make this every single day its a nice mix of sweet and healthy and its a nice shade of purple the kids love this before school they always tell me to make them one thank you for the recipe!!!

I’ve made this recipe 3 times now ! My girls love it ! It’s delicious and easy . I’ve used regular plain yogurt as recipe suggest and Indian plain yogurt ! Both delicious! A keeper recipe and will make from here on out - adding to our family recipe book ! Thank you for a great recipe !!!
I am new to smoothie preparation, but I found this recipe to be excellent. I used blueberry yogurt and substituted Splenda for the sugar, since I am a diabetic. Turned out beautifully!
I use a peach protein shake to substitute the yogurt and the milk it’s is so good
I just the recipe a little bit add a little more milk and add cinnamon instead of nutmeg. I did not have white sugar but had raw sugar and use that love the out come.
I absoulty loved this
Didn't even add the sugar and it was delicious! Thanks for the recipe
I used lemon yogurt and left out the nutmeg (because I was out of it) and this was absolutely delicious!
I LOVE LOVE LOVE this recipe. Changed few thing....didn’t have yogurt and used cashew milk as the milk substitute and raw cane sugar instead of white sugar. I can’t wait to make this again!!
Amazing recipe! I used nonfat vanilla yogurt instead of the plain and did not put in vanilla extract-- it was delicious. Beautiful color.
Really loved this great taste easy to make
Agree on not using the nutmeg otherwise good
I liked this recipe I made it with vanilla yogurt and 1 teaspoon of sugar and lowfat milk.
I am ABSOLUTELY in love with this recipe!! Best smoothie I ever had! And so easy. Thank you.
I split all of the ingredients in half to make a smaller smoothie, And i preferably did not use the nutmeg. I put too much sugar.
Used Splenda instead of sugar
It was delicious! I took out the nutmeg and sugar and just used a banana instead. Turned out so well and was very filling
I used two cups of ice even though I had frozen blueberries... liked it better with ice.

I did have to use strawberry yogurt since I didn't have any plain yogurt, but it still tastes delicious even though I did spill the vanilla extract on the ground because I accidentally forgot to put the lid on, it was worth it! But what is the leaf at the top?
It was really good! I used fresh blueberries and vanilla yogurt instead of plain yogurt and vanilla extract. It was the perfect amount of sweetness!
I really like this. I used strawberry banana yogurt because it was all I had and my nutmeg container was almost empty so I used pumpkin pie spice. Very tasty !

I substituted vanilla yogurt for the plain & vanilla extract. I used 3/4 cup yogurt (ran out)
Delicious!

Delicious and refreshing. I used unsweetened Almond Milk, 2#3 cup frozen blueberries, 1 5oz. Chobani Greek Coconut Yogurt, 1/4tsp of cinnamon, 1/2 of a small frozen banana, and 1/8 tsp of cocoa powder. No need for any added sugar.
I didn't make any changes and when I tried it, It was so good I drunk the whole cup!

So, I added half a cup of frozen pineapple, used a hair less yogurt, and instead of nutmeg, I added honey, and it turned out to be the BEST smoothie I've had. The only reason why I'm giving it only 4 stars is because without the changes I made, it was just alright.
Love it
Wow! The nutmeg is a must! I used the exact ingredients except I used 1 cup of Vanilla yogurt and omitted the vanilla extract. Delicious!!
A little too frothy. The blueberry skin was not a good texture. Otherwise very flavorful.
I left out the sugar thinking that it would be sweet enough however next time I will add the sugar.
I’m glad I started with two TEAspoons of sugar because that is all it needed!
Instead of using nutmeg I used cinnamon and it was so good
Super easy and delicious. Perfect thing to have just before school or work!
This was amazing! I am 12 and made this with a friend. Everyone loved it! The only thing I did differently is I put a banana and some raspberries in! Tysm!
I loved this. And it was so easy to make.
Made as directions read, but added 6 ice cubes

This was great - I substituted no added sugar vanilla almond coconut milk, 1 pkt of stevia instead of sugar, cut yogurt to 6 oz. and added and half a frozen banana. Will make again!
Thanks for the recipe!
It was very good. I didn’t use even half of the sugar it called for and added more berries. Definitely a great summer drink!
I made it with almond milk and it turned out amazing!
Tastes like purple yogurt with nutmeg

This is a wonderful beverage. In place of sugar I used Sweet & Low. I filled up my glass and poured another class if it and put it in the freezer. Before going to bed I took the frozen cup of smoothie In the refrigerator. What a delightful morning breakfast. It was so good!!
The smoothie is very simple to make as well.
Just made my first BB smoothie. Wasn’t enthusiastic about the whole cup of yogurt. Next time I will try less yogurt.
Everyone loved it! I substituted a bit of the plain yogurt with strawberry yogurt so I wouldn't have to add vanilla extract. To add an extra hint of deliciousness, I would add a few mint leaves.

Loved it. I needed a way to incorporate frozen blueberry (since blueberries are so good for blood vessel health I just read) into our diet and could only think of blueberry pie, good but not so healthy. This was perfect.
I used the little frozen wild blueberries and it was fantastic!
I used Honey and Vanilla Greek yogurt and did not add sugar!
I added regular milk instead of what it called for, and it turned out perfect! Highly recommended!!
I will make it again
A delicious blueberry smoothie! Doubles perfectly, and is a great way to use up blueberries before they expire!
Easy and very good! Had some really terrible blueberries and this was still excellent!
I love it so much. I can't stop drinking it.
I made this a few days ago with blueberries, then again today with a 16 oz bag frozen blueberries, blackberries, and strawberries. Both times This came out great
Best smoothie I have ever made!
My kids made this and it was a bit hit!!
I used blueberry yogurt because I didn't have normal. And oh my goodness it's amazing. It's kind a thick, but I might try ice next time and see if it helps the thickness
Delicious

Skipped the nutmeg because I'm not a fan. Otherwise good. I'll likely double the sugar next time and add about a half cup more berries or other fruit.

Did come out like a smoothie, but could have a bit more flavor hence why I'll try more sugar and fruit next time.

Still pretty good. Made two large glasses worth.
I used low-sugar yogurt, didn't add white sugar, and included cinnamon and ground flaxseed.
Not bad. Left out the nutmeg, we only have whole ones.
amazing recipe!!! love it!!
I love it. I left out the nutmeg because I didn't have any. I drink this for breakfast every morning now it helps keep me full longer
This was pretty good I have had better blueberry smoothies though and I used apple pie spice instead of nut meg I might make this again but I have a recipe I like that I’ll keep using.

Five year old approved - my little guy is working to gain some weight, so I used whole milk, whole yogurt, a scoop of vanilla ice cream as the "sugar", added half of a banana, and ground chia seeds.
Next time I will also add some flax seed oil, licorice powder, holy basil powder, pure bone broth collagen powder, cocoa powder, and dandelion root powder (very small increments of each. I feel the flavor will easily mask the added goodies)

My kids loved this! We had strawberries out of our garden so I added them to the blueberries. My five year kept telling "smoothies!" whenever she took a drink and my two year old refused to share with me. I will definitely make it again.

I used plain greek yogurt (20 grams protein per cup), 2 tsp of orange blossom honey. I used frozen blueberries and some fresh blackberries and strawberries. Whole milk and a dash of nutmeg. Delicious!
Not a big smoothie person, but I thought I'd give this a shot. It was chunky and just gross. On the plus side, it was pretty in the glass!

Tastes great, but if you're using fresh blueberries, I definitely recommend adding ice because even using cold ingredients it was warm. 

I'm not a nutmeg fan, so I was dubious, but since I used vanilla yogurt (because it's what I had on hand) I think it balanced pretty well.
Not a fan of nutmeg! Go easy on the vanilla extract. Delicious.
This was very tasty and I'm not a fan of blueberries! I followed the recipe but I did add some fresh ginger and it only enhanced an already tasty drink!!!
I LOVE SMOOTHIES and this is my absolute favorite recipe!!!! I back off on the sugar just a little bit. Its an amazing smoothie! I really recommend this recipe!!!
from all the smoothie recipes on allrecipes, this has got to be the best one ! :)

I am always on the look out for a good smoothie. I made a couple of changes as i am lactose intolerant.
I used almond milk and lactose free Activia yogurt, and cut back on the sugar a bit.I also added some protein powder to the smoothie. It was delicious.
Thank you for the recipe.
I love the blue berry smoothie it taste so good

I scaled this down to one serving and used frozen blueberries and honey in place of the sugar. I also added a scoop of vanillla protein powder, which I always do with smoothies. Nutmeg doesn't appeal to me in something like this, so I just gave it a shake of cinnamon. Very good!
Since I didn't have plain yogurt I used strawberry yoplait and it was an amazing substitute.
I haven't made smoothies before. This recipe is quite tasty. I do plan on making it again.
Will make again to be sure.
Loved it! Such a good way to use the blueberries that are always sitting in my freezer!
I really enjoyed this. The only thing I did was to cut the recipe in half. I've just started to eat healthy and this is the best thing I've had yet. October 18, 2016
I liked this recipe and will definitely make it again in the future. I don't like nutmeg so I didn't use any.
The only substitution I did was to use Splenda instead of sugar. I did not care for it because it was not cold and I did not want to water it down by adding ice.

5 stars for all 3 of my kids (ages 9, 6 & 1) LOVING this smoothie! I wasn't sure about the nutmeg (and personally think I would prefer it without the spice) but they raved about the nutmeg with the blueberry & my 1 year old couldn't get enough! I doubled the recipe, used whole milk & slightly less sugar (3T per double). I will definitely make this again. Oh & I would recommend frozen berries...smoothies always taste better when they are really cold, imo!
